column4: hey guys, anyone out here know how to change ubuntu to accept widescreen resolutions on an Olevia LCD tv?  I'd really appreciate it.
does the LCD tv offer its native res over PC input?
is this a secondary monitor or what?
no, my primary: I have a winbox running to it via dvi and it works great
ah so what are you on now?
using a second system hooked up via the vga port (I would use dvi, but this dell only has vga out)
I want to thank you in advanced for helping out anyway you can, it sure is nice.
ok so you want the linux pc to get dvi to the lcdtv?
laptop=linux/vga only and computer=windows/dvi only  or am i confused?
no can do since my dell with ubuntu only has vga out.  I'm trying to get ubuntu to use a widescreen resolution on it
heh, this is one of those micro cases and for some bizarre reason they cheaped out on dvi
ah ok what kind of driver are you using on the dell
ok what is the native resoluton of the lcdtv?
since it's an HD monitor, it can do up to 1080i.  Personally, I'd be completely fine with 720p which I believe is 1280x720
some LCD tvs however do not allow tv input at the native
does the lcd tv work at all if you hook it up to the dell (laptop right?)
I'm not quite sure I follow what you mean by that.  Are you saying that my tv might not support widescreen via vga?  I know I've been able to get it to work in XP, if that's any help
nah that's not really what i'm saying.
if it works in XP it  can work in linux
does XP use the biggest resolution too?
does XP work with the biggest/native resolution of the LCD TV ?  just curious
when you hook the LCDTV up to the dell laptop's external VGA what happens?  nothing?
